posts.title: Trans pilot falsely blamed in Potomac plane crash sues conservative influencer
top_comments:
> On Jan. 30, less than 24 hours after the crash, conservative influencer Matt Wallace, who has 2.2 million followers on the social media platform X, shared a post from another account he operates stating that the helicopter pilot was transgender, according to the lawsuit. Wallace included a photo of Ellis, and the post went viral, the lawsuit states.  
Wallace deleted that original post, according to the lawsuit, and then shared two others linking Ellis to the crash. One referred to an interview that Ellis did with The Smerconish Podcast, in which she said President Donald Trump’s executive order barring trans people from serving and enlisting in the military made her nervous. 
The second post included photos of Ellis and said she might have participated in “another trans terror attack,” according to the lawsuit. That post received 4.8 million views on X, the suit states.


Slandering someone for a non-existent terrorist attack absolutely deserves a lawsuit. I hope they end up having to pay a massive amount of money. That's a great way to have her be targeted by death threats and possibly physical attacks. Imagine joining the National Guard for almost 20 years, then some ass does this to you.
Here’s to her winning the lawsuit. It’s high time these conservative influencers need to be held accountable for their words.

Matt Wallace is such a low-life. I feel terrible for this pilot. She didn’t do shit to deserve this and now has to deal with the burden of clearing her name after being dragged into something she never asked for.
Even if she wins (which I hope she does), they never pay out. Look at the Alex Jones and Rudy Guilliano verdicts.
Unfortunately, america no longer has a justice system.
I hope she can retire and live comfortably off the judgement awarded while the piece of shit is bankrupted.

Trans people are such terrors that the GOP has to constantly make up complete bullshit to paint them in a bad light...

If you have to lie, and lie to such an insane degree, to justify your beliefs, maybe your beliefs are shit?  Just a thought, which I know the GOP does not allow.
Matt Wallace is a little piece of shit. If only our "justice system" actually helped people rather than ya know... Protect the rich

Nothing gets conservative wackos to backtrack on their bullshit quicker than getting hit with a massive judgment.

See also: Dominion
Sounds like 100 million to me. These guys all need to be bankrupted. All of them.

posts.title: Gunman who killed 23 in a racist attack at a Walmart in El Paso pleads guilty to capital murder
top_comments:
>Patrick Crusius was automatically be sentenced to life in prison without parole in the massacre near the U.S.-Mexico border. The change of plea comes after local prosecutors took the death penalty off the table.

>El Paso County District Attorney James Montoya declined to pursue the death penalty, saying that decision was driven by a majority of victims’ relatives who want the case to be over.

I can see the sentiment of just wanting to not think about it anymore. The murderer is 26 now and will likely spend decades in [a Texas prison](https://www.texastribune.org/2022/08/24/texas-prisons-air-conditioning/).
So death for the UHC CEO murderer, but this dude gets to live?  Cool.  Cool.
Wait, hold on. This guy kills 23 people in a racist attack and isn't considered a terrorist, but a guy killing a corrupt CEO is a terrorist?

> About 100 people from victims’ families were seated in the gallery behind a few rows reserved for media, prosecutors and Crusius’ defense team. They will be given the time to give victim impact statements starting Monday afternoon. Dozens made emotional statements during a similar hearing in federal court in 2023 that lasted for three days.

> The people who were killed at Walmart ranged in age from a 15-year-old high school athlete to elderly grandparents. They included immigrants, a retired city bus driver, a teacher, tradesmen including a former iron worker, and several Mexican nationals who had crossed the U.S. border on routine shopping trips.

Those people leave behind a legacy of loved ones who will keep their memories alive. 100 loved ones to share their stories. This man leaves no legacy but hatred, and will be remembered as a bigoted monster. May he rot in prison and fade into obscurity.

> The online rant speaks of a “Hispanic invasion of Texas.”

>“They are the instigators, not me,” it says. “I am simply defending my country from cultural and ethnic replacement brought on by an invasion.”


Asshole never studied U.S. history, clearly. It’s the other way around.

23 people. Killed. In a grocery store.  

Make it make sense. 2 is horrible but 23????

I was just thinking about this the other day. Some madman guns down Hispanics at Walmart enraged at Mexicans under Trump's stoking of hatred, for said group. Mad man kills a mother and father leaving a baby homeless. Uncle of the baby is a MAGA lover, finds out Trump is coming, first thought is not overwhelming grief for his lost sister and orphaned niece, no he thinks! Bingo! If I grab the baby like a prop and head back to hospital where my sister and brother in law just died, maybe I can get a picture with Trump! https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2019/aug/09/trump-el-paso-melania-orphan-baby-thumbs-up
And he got his picture. I always think of this when people get shocked that the maga won't turn on him.

It's important to note that you cannot appeal a conviction in which you plead guilty to with much chance of success. 

Most appeals that are successful aren't about innocence, but procedural mistakes by the prosecution and law enforcement officers in the case. 

As high profile as this is, I imagine that the last thing anyone wants is for someone to have made one tiny mistake in an otherwise open and shut case and this guy go free because of it. There is still the fact that the judge can alter sentencing, and order modifiers such as without parole, or non concurrent sentences, meaning a separate life sentence for each victim, to be stacked on top of each other. 

I'm not a huge fan of the death penalty, but that's not the only way to make sure this man never walks away free.
Surely the charges will be as bad as Luigi, right?

We just shouldn’t have the death penalty at all. It’s far too permanent for something we can’t be right about 100% of the time. And life in prison is already a severe punishment (deservedly, in this case). Allowing our justice system to give in to bloodlust doesn’t help our society

posts.title: Pope Francis has died, Vatican says in video statement
top_comments: I'm glad he made it out of the hospital, anyway. He died in his own bed.
Must have been holding out for one last Easter
Gone the day after Easter. Idk, is there anything more... Catholic? May he rest in eternal peace far from the trials and tribulations of Earth.
Hope he went peacefully, and I hope the transition to the next pope goes smooth as well.

> Francis appointed nearly 80% of the cardinal electors who will choose the next pope, increasing the possibility that his successor will continue his progressive policies, despite the strong pushback from traditionalists.


This will provide some hope.

I was a closeted teenager in Catholic school when he was elected, and as he preached compassion over the years I felt like I could tangibly sense the people around me change their viewpoints on queerness. So many of my family members, including my godfather, changed their minds without knowing at the time that I was queer. I think it made me feel a lot more secure in my self when I did decide to start coming out a few years ago.

I'm not Catholic anymore, but I think it would have taken me a lot longer to get on my own path if not for him. I'll always appreciate him for that. I hope he knows that he helped a little lesbian feel a bit more loved.

Edit - OH MY GOD thank you guys for the awards!!!!!!

Damn, the guy clung to life for that Easter appearance, probably because he knew that it would mean a lot to a lot of people and then he just let go. 

Rest in Peace, Francis. You were actually a good Pope. 

I hope we can find someone similar, especially in these insane times.
I hope the next pope is as kind and generous as this one was, we need it right now.
We gonna get another conclave boys.
At least he lived past Easter and lived long enough to make that impact standing.

posts.title: Entire staff at federal agency that funds libraries and museums put on leave
top_comments:
With a 2025 budget of $295 Million, cutting the IMLS will offset Trump's golf expenses.  

Musk is still looking for cuts to help cover Trump's trip to the Superbowl and the Daytona 500.

There was a time when we used to look up to smart people.  

Now, smart people are a threat to the dumb fucks trying to destroy the country for their own profit.
Libraries: the nexus of evil

Yup our state library staff is being laid off due to federal cuts. It’s really depressing. These libraries help low income children with meals during the summer due to school being closed and not providing food.

All the money these oligarchs have and they’re cutting programs that help kids have food. This is despicable.
This timeline is just getting depressing at this point.
Republicans have been against libraries and non-commercial museums for decades. Sad more voters didn't consider this outcome when voting to give them more power.

[This tweet remains relevant](https://x.com/sketchesbyboze/status/1304555319817797634?s=46&t=gYqP6Q5IoxKTzkC236AFpA)

> my girlfriend regularly tells me “if free public libraries didn’t already exist and someone tried to invent them, they would be condemned as a socialist plot” and I think about that a lot.

You know I would love to ask someone who voted for these clowns ONE question when I see things like this.

What is the benefit to the American people of doing things like this?  

And I would really like an honest answer. But doubt I'd ever get one.
Welp, now I know why Cruz and Cornyn want to move the Discovery to Texas...
Reminds me of the book Fahrenheit 451

posts.title: Red Lake Nation citizen cited for ‘fake’ license plates in Georgia
top_comments: I feel that the old, "Ignorance of the law, is no excuse." should apply to the Police as well, in fact, even more so, as that's literally their only job. Enforcing laws. You'd think they'd bother to learn a couple.
I just saw tribal plates for the first time last week and had to do a double take. I actually didn't realize tribal plates were a thing but I feel like cops should probably know better.
SC Justice Gorsuch will eat this up, he may be a conservative but he also has a bone to pick about how state and federal government have trampled native rights in the US. It's weird.
To be fair, it’s Georgia, there’s a good chance the cops were illiterate.

Where I live we see Mexico license plates sometimes. I’d think that would be pretty much the same as tribal plates. Maybe the real issue is that the Georgia officer couldn’t lookup the plate number or verify it?
Kind of surprised that the cop didn't let him go after ordering him to remove the plates, then pull him over a mile later and ticket him for not having plates, since the guy argued about it.
Was expecting some Sov Citizen nonsense before reading the article

Reading the article, it does seem like the legality of tribal plates is questionable in the state of Georgia. Even the Red Lake lawyer cited says "should be recognized by Georgia", not that it is recognized. And I agree that it should be but I don't think this is a matter of "dumb cop didn't know the law".

In Oklahoma many of the tribes issue their own plates.  Surely they don't have these same issues driving around to other states like this?  Tribal plates aren't a new thing and police shouldn't be surprised by them at this point.  Morons.

A smart lawyer should be able to get both citations dismissed before the court date. If the unusual plate is what caused the officer to begin tailing in the hope of a citation then they tacked on the speeding it may be fruit-of-the-poison-tree. If the other way around & there was an assumption of lenience on the speed except that the officer did not know how to record then it might be just dismissed.

posts.title: US citizen wrongfully arrested by border patrol in Arizona held for nearly 10 days | US immigration
top_comments:
Notice the recurring theme of how the border cops always lie to the court and say that the US citizen confessed to them (with zero evidence) to being an illegal immigrant? 

“According to a border patrol criminal complaint, on 8 April, a border patrol official found Hermosillo “without the proper immigration documents” and claimed that the young American had admitted entering the US illegally from Mexico. Two days later, the federal court document notes that Hermosillo continued to claim he was a US citizen. On 17 April, a federal judge dismissed his case.”
Nothing in America takes 10 days.  They knew after an hour, maybe two.  The other 238 hours were because they didn't like him.
This is the 2nd incident of a US citizen being detained. Another US citizen in Florida was detained last week

Yesterday NBC published an article on what to do if you’re a US citizen detained by ICE. Unbelievable that this is happening, and how fast we’ve fallen.

https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/us-citizens-email-notice-to-deport-rcna201862
Remember when Democrats warned this would happen and republican said we were fear mongering.

Trump's personal gestapo. There's a reason organizations like border patrol, corrections and homeland security were deployed to Portland during the George Floyd protests. This isn't trump 1.0 with the Drumpf jokes, Rudy's hair peeling off and the four seasons landscaping fiasco. This is organized. They've got a plan and they're putting it into motion. Who knows where this will end.

*Travelling while brown*.

Only *felony interference with profit* is worse.

Ice needs to be dissolved and a new immigration enforcement agency needs to be built in its place. 

It’s obvious the current culture of ice doesn’t care about due process.
What sucks is anyone with a spanish ancestry who looks..."spanish"  is getting stopped.

Border patrol agents are scum, just straight up lying. It is actually terrifying that ICE is detaining US citizens. It has now happened in several states. 

>”According to a border patrol criminal complaint, on 8 April, a border patrol official found Hermosillo “without the proper immigration documents” and claimed that the young American had admitted entering the US illegally from Mexico.

>”He did say he was a US citizen, but they didn’t believe him,” Hermosillo’s girlfriend’s aunt told AZPM. “I think they would have kept him. I think they would have, if they would have not got that information yesterday in the court, and gave that to Ice and the border patrol. He probably would have been deported already to Mexico.”

posts.title: Gunman who killed 23 in a racist attack at a Walmart in El Paso pleads guilty to capital murder
top_comments:
>Patrick Crusius was automatically be sentenced to life in prison without parole in the massacre near the U.S.-Mexico border. The change of plea comes after local prosecutors took the death penalty off the table.

>El Paso County District Attorney James Montoya declined to pursue the death penalty, saying that decision was driven by a majority of victims’ relatives who want the case to be over.

I can see the sentiment of just wanting to not think about it anymore. The murderer is 26 now and will likely spend decades in [a Texas prison](https://www.texastribune.org/2022/08/24/texas-prisons-air-conditioning/).
So death for the UHC CEO murderer, but this dude gets to live?  Cool.  Cool.
Wait, hold on. This guy kills 23 people in a racist attack and isn't considered a terrorist, but a guy killing a corrupt CEO is a terrorist?

> About 100 people from victims’ families were seated in the gallery behind a few rows reserved for media, prosecutors and Crusius’ defense team. They will be given the time to give victim impact statements starting Monday afternoon. Dozens made emotional statements during a similar hearing in federal court in 2023 that lasted for three days.

> The people who were killed at Walmart ranged in age from a 15-year-old high school athlete to elderly grandparents. They included immigrants, a retired city bus driver, a teacher, tradesmen including a former iron worker, and several Mexican nationals who had crossed the U.S. border on routine shopping trips.

Those people leave behind a legacy of loved ones who will keep their memories alive. 100 loved ones to share their stories. This man leaves no legacy but hatred, and will be remembered as a bigoted monster. May he rot in prison and fade into obscurity.

> The online rant speaks of a “Hispanic invasion of Texas.”

>“They are the instigators, not me,” it says. “I am simply defending my country from cultural and ethnic replacement brought on by an invasion.”


Asshole never studied U.S. history, clearly. It’s the other way around.

23 people. Killed. In a grocery store.  

Make it make sense. 2 is horrible but 23????

I was just thinking about this the other day. Some madman guns down Hispanics at Walmart enraged at Mexicans under Trump's stoking of hatred, for said group. Mad man kills a mother and father leaving a baby homeless. Uncle of the baby is a MAGA lover, finds out Trump is coming, first thought is not overwhelming grief for his lost sister and orphaned niece, no he thinks! Bingo! If I grab the baby like a prop and head back to hospital where my sister and brother in law just died, maybe I can get a picture with Trump! https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2019/aug/09/trump-el-paso-melania-orphan-baby-thumbs-up
And he got his picture. I always think of this when people get shocked that the maga won't turn on him.

It's important to note that you cannot appeal a conviction in which you plead guilty to with much chance of success. 

Most appeals that are successful aren't about innocence, but procedural mistakes by the prosecution and law enforcement officers in the case. 

As high profile as this is, I imagine that the last thing anyone wants is for someone to have made one tiny mistake in an otherwise open and shut case and this guy go free because of it. There is still the fact that the judge can alter sentencing, and order modifiers such as without parole, or non concurrent sentences, meaning a separate life sentence for each victim, to be stacked on top of each other. 

I'm not a huge fan of the death penalty, but that's not the only way to make sure this man never walks away free.
Surely the charges will be as bad as Luigi, right?

We just shouldn’t have the death penalty at all. It’s far too permanent for something we can’t be right about 100% of the time. And life in prison is already a severe punishment (deservedly, in this case). Allowing our justice system to give in to bloodlust doesn’t help our society

And I would really like an honest answer. But doubt I'd ever get one.
Welp, now I know why Cruz and Cornyn want to move the Discovery to Texas...
Reminds me of the book Fahrenheit 451

posts.title: Red Lake Nation citizen cited for ‘fake’ license plates in Georgia
top_comments: I feel that the old, "Ignorance of the law, is no excuse." should apply to the Police as well, in fact, even more so, as that's literally their only job. Enforcing laws. You'd think they'd bother to learn a couple.
I just saw tribal plates for the first time last week and had to do a double take. I actually didn't realize tribal plates were a thing but I feel like cops should probably know better.
SC Justice Gorsuch will eat this up, he may be a conservative but he also has a bone to pick about how state and federal government have trampled native rights in the US. It's weird.
To be fair, it’s Georgia, there’s a good chance the cops were illiterate.

Where I live we see Mexico license plates sometimes. I’d think that would be pretty much the same as tribal plates. Maybe the real issue is that the Georgia officer couldn’t lookup the plate number or verify it?
Kind of surprised that the cop didn't let him go after ordering him to remove the plates, then pull him over a mile later and ticket him for not having plates, since the guy argued about it.
Was expecting some Sov Citizen nonsense before reading the article

Reading the article, it does seem like the legality of tribal plates is questionable in the state of Georgia. Even the Red Lake lawyer cited says "should be recognized by Georgia", not that it is recognized. And I agree that it should be but I don't think this is a matter of "dumb cop didn't know the law".

In Oklahoma many of the tribes issue their own plates.  Surely they don't have these same issues driving around to other states like this?  Tribal plates aren't a new thing and police shouldn't be surprised by them at this point.  Morons.

A smart lawyer should be able to get both citations dismissed before the court date. If the unusual plate is what caused the officer to begin tailing in the hope of a citation then they tacked on the speeding it may be fruit-of-the-poison-tree. If the other way around & there was an assumption of lenience on the speed except that the officer did not know how to record then it might be just dismissed.

posts.title: Trans pilot falsely blamed in Potomac plane crash sues conservative influencer
top_comments:
> On Jan. 30, less than 24 hours after the crash, conservative influencer Matt Wallace, who has 2.2 million followers on the social media platform X, shared a post from another account he operates stating that the helicopter pilot was transgender, according to the lawsuit. Wallace included a photo of Ellis, and the post went viral, the lawsuit states.  
Wallace deleted that original post, according to the lawsuit, and then shared two others linking Ellis to the crash. One referred to an interview that Ellis did with The Smerconish Podcast, in which she said President Donald Trump’s executive order barring trans people from serving and enlisting in the military made her nervous. 
The second post included photos of Ellis and said she might have participated in “another trans terror attack,” according to the lawsuit. That post received 4.8 million views on X, the suit states.


Slandering someone for a non-existent terrorist attack absolutely deserves a lawsuit. I hope they end up having to pay a massive amount of money. That's a great way to have her be targeted by death threats and possibly physical attacks. Imagine joining the National Guard for almost 20 years, then some ass does this to you.
Here’s to her winning the lawsuit. It’s high time these conservative influencers need to be held accountable for their words.

Matt Wallace is such a low-life. I feel terrible for this pilot. She didn’t do shit to deserve this and now has to deal with the burden of clearing her name after being dragged into something she never asked for.
Even if she wins (which I hope she does), they never pay out. Look at the Alex Jones and Rudy Guilliano verdicts.
Unfortunately, america no longer has a justice system.
I hope she can retire and live comfortably off the judgement awarded while the piece of shit is bankrupted.

Trans people are such terrors that the GOP has to constantly make up complete bullshit to paint them in a bad light...

If you have to lie, and lie to such an insane degree, to justify your beliefs, maybe your beliefs are shit?  Just a thought, which I know the GOP does not allow.
Matt Wallace is a little piece of shit. If only our "justice system" actually helped people rather than ya know... Protect the rich

Nothing gets conservative wackos to backtrack on their bullshit quicker than getting hit with a massive judgment.

See also: Dominion
Sounds like 100 million to me. These guys all need to be bankrupted. All of them.

posts.title: Entire staff at federal agency that funds libraries and museums put on leave
top_comments:
With a 2025 budget of $295 Million, cutting the IMLS will offset Trump's golf expenses.  

Musk is still looking for cuts to help cover Trump's trip to the Superbowl and the Daytona 500.

There was a time when we used to look up to smart people.  

Now, smart people are a threat to the dumb fucks trying to destroy the country for their own profit.
Libraries: the nexus of evil

Yup our state library staff is being laid off due to federal cuts. It’s really depressing. These libraries help low income children with meals during the summer due to school being closed and not providing food.

All the money these oligarchs have and they’re cutting programs that help kids have food. This is despicable.
This timeline is just getting depressing at this point.
Republicans have been against libraries and non-commercial museums for decades. Sad more voters didn't consider this outcome when voting to give them more power.

[This tweet remains relevant](https://x.com/sketchesbyboze/status/1304555319817797634?s=46&t=gYqP6Q5IoxKTzkC236AFpA)

> my girlfriend regularly tells me “if free public libraries didn’t already exist and someone tried to invent them, they would be condemned as a socialist plot” and I think about that a lot.

You know I would love to ask someone who voted for these clowns ONE question when I see things like this.

What is the benefit to the American people of doing things like this?  

And I would really like an honest answer. But doubt I'd ever get one.
Welp, now I know why Cruz and Cornyn want to move the Discovery to Texas...
Reminds me of the book Fahrenheit 451

posts.title: Dow tumbles more than 1,000 points and dollar hits three-year low
top_comments: He's running the country like he does all of his businesses. Imagine being this incompetent, but also so unaware.

Long term gain, though, right?

...you guys?
Reminder that Trump enjoys a 90% approval rating from Republicans right now
If Powell leaves it'll tumble another 1000.

Funny, I used to get little quips from my retired parents anytime the stock market went down under Biden (“he just cost me $xxxxx”). Haven’t heard a single comment about their portfolio since trump took office
I think a corky laugh and a stable 401k would’ve been better than this.
MAGA: This is good. We shouldn't be involved in any foreign exchanges anyway. It costs nothing to lose money.
Im so tired of winning.
The value of a dollar is rapidly approaching its lowest low since the last time this skidmark was in office

Yesterday, had a family member say, “Imagine how bad it would be if Harris had won.”

I should text him and say, well, the Dow wouldn’t be at a 3 year low.

posts.title: Gunman who killed 23 in a racist attack at a Walmart in El Paso pleads guilty to capital murder
top_comments:
>Patrick Crusius was automatically be sentenced to life in prison without parole in the massacre near the U.S.-Mexico border. The change of plea comes after local prosecutors took the death penalty off the table.

>El Paso County District Attorney James Montoya declined to pursue the death penalty, saying that decision was driven by a majority of victims’ relatives who want the case to be over.

I can see the sentiment of just wanting to not think about it anymore. The murderer is 26 now and will likely spend decades in [a Texas prison](https://www.texastribune.org/2022/08/24/texas-prisons-air-conditioning/).
So death for the UHC CEO murderer, but this dude gets to live?  Cool.  Cool.
Wait, hold on. This guy kills 23 people in a racist attack and isn't considered a terrorist, but a guy killing a corrupt CEO is a terrorist?

> About 100 people from victims’ families were seated in the gallery behind a few rows reserved for media, prosecutors and Crusius’ defense team. They will be given the time to give victim impact statements starting Monday afternoon. Dozens made emotional statements during a similar hearing in federal court in 2023 that lasted for three days.

> The people who were killed at Walmart ranged in age from a 15-year-old high school athlete to elderly grandparents. They included immigrants, a retired city bus driver, a teacher, tradesmen including a former iron worker, and several Mexican nationals who had crossed the U.S. border on routine shopping trips.

Those people leave behind a legacy of loved ones who will keep their memories alive. 100 loved ones to share their stories. This man leaves no legacy but hatred, and will be remembered as a bigoted monster. May he rot in prison and fade into obscurity.

> The online rant speaks of a “Hispanic invasion of Texas.”

>“They are the instigators, not me,” it says. “I am simply defending my country from cultural and ethnic replacement brought on by an invasion.”


Asshole never studied U.S. history, clearly. It’s the other way around.

23 people. Killed. In a grocery store.  

Make it make sense. 2 is horrible but 23????

I was just thinking about this the other day. Some madman guns down Hispanics at Walmart enraged at Mexicans under Trump's stoking of hatred, for said group. Mad man kills a mother and father leaving a baby homeless. Uncle of the baby is a MAGA lover, finds out Trump is coming, first thought is not overwhelming grief for his lost sister and orphaned niece, no he thinks! Bingo! If I grab the baby like a prop and head back to hospital where my sister and brother in law just died, maybe I can get a picture with Trump! https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2019/aug/09/trump-el-paso-melania-orphan-baby-thumbs-up
And he got his picture. I always think of this when people get shocked that the maga won't turn on him.

It's important to note that you cannot appeal a conviction in which you plead guilty to with much chance of success. 

Most appeals that are successful aren't about innocence, but procedural mistakes by the prosecution and law enforcement officers in the case. 

As high profile as this is, I imagine that the last thing anyone wants is for someone to have made one tiny mistake in an otherwise open and shut case and this guy go free because of it. There is still the fact that the judge can alter sentencing, and order modifiers such as without parole, or non concurrent sentences, meaning a separate life sentence for each victim, to be stacked on top of each other. 

I'm not a huge fan of the death penalty, but that's not the only way to make sure this man never walks away free.
Surely the charges will be as bad as Luigi, right?

We just shouldn’t have the death penalty at all. It’s far too permanent for something we can’t be right about 100% of the time. And life in prison is already a severe punishment (deservedly, in this case). Allowing our justice system to give in to bloodlust doesn’t help our society

Many cite fears over limited job prospects, insecurity, and the Taliban's ongoing restrictions on women...*

Add to this the 9,000 Afghans presently seeking asylum in the U.S. who are about to be deported.
Not to distract but I thought the thumbnail was ace Ventura in a rhino
Holy fuck the world is a mess. Why did I choose 2025 to start watching the news and paying attention.

The ones who least wanted the democratic regime to fall were those absent when it did. 
Tragic.

posts.title: Pope Francis has died, Vatican says in video statement
top_comments: I'm glad he made it out of the hospital, anyway. He died in his own bed.
Must have been holding out for one last Easter
Gone the day after Easter. Idk, is there anything more... Catholic? May he rest in eternal peace far from the trials and tribulations of Earth.
Hope he went peacefully, and I hope the transition to the next pope goes smooth as well.

> Francis appointed nearly 80% of the cardinal electors who will choose the next pope, increasing the possibility that his successor will continue his progressive policies, despite the strong pushback from traditionalists.


This will provide some hope.

I was a closeted teenager in Catholic school when he was elected, and as he preached compassion over the years I felt like I could tangibly sense the people around me change their viewpoints on queerness. So many of my family members, including my godfather, changed their minds without knowing at the time that I was queer. I think it made me feel a lot more secure in my self when I did decide to start coming out a few years ago.

I'm not Catholic anymore, but I think it would have taken me a lot longer to get on my own path if not for him. I'll always appreciate him for that. I hope he knows that he helped a little lesbian feel a bit more loved.

Edit - OH MY GOD thank you guys for the awards!!!!!!

Damn, the guy clung to life for that Easter appearance, probably because he knew that it would mean a lot to a lot of people and then he just let go. 

Rest in Peace, Francis. You were actually a good Pope. 

I hope we can find someone similar, especially in these insane times.
I hope the next pope is as kind and generous as this one was, we need it right now.
We gonna get another conclave boys.
At least he lived past Easter and lived long enough to make that impact standing.
